body:
<!--
**PLEASE READ THIS FIRST:**
- Do not use the bug and feature tracker for support requests. Use the `cython-users` mailing list instead.
- Did you search for similar issues already? Please do, it helps to save us precious time that we otherwise could not invest into development.
- Did you try the latest master branch or pre-release? It might already have what you want to report. Also see the [Changelog](https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/master/CHANGES.rst) regarding recent changes.
-->

**Describe the bug**

Code generated from the following Cython source, when compiled with `-DCYTHON_TRACE_NOGIL=1` generates compilation warning ``warning: ‘__pyx_gilstate_save’ may be used uninitialized in this function``.

```
gcc -pthread -B ~/miniconda3/envs/gh767/compiler_compat -Wno-unused-result -Wsign-compare -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O2 -Wall -fPIC -O2 -isystem ~/miniconda3/envs/gh767/include -fPIC -O2 -isystem ~/miniconda3/envs/gh767/include -fPIC -DCYTHON_TRACE_NOGIL=1 -DCYTHON_TRACE=1 -I~/miniconda3/envs/gh767/include/python3.10 -c gh767/_ext.c -o build/temp.linux-x86_64-3.10/gh767/_ext.o
gh767/_ext.c: In function ‘__pyx_pw_5gh767_4_ext_1handler’:
gh767/_ext.c:898:34: warning: ‘__pyx_gilstate_save’ may be used uninitialized in this function [-Wmaybe-uninitialized]
  898 | #define __Pyx_PyGILState_Release PyGILState_Release
      |                                  ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
gh767/_ext.c:1906:20: note: ‘__pyx_gilstate_save’ was declared here
 1906 |   PyGILState_STATE __pyx_gilstate_save;
      |                    ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
creating build/lib.linux-x86_64-3.10
```

The warning is observed for both C and C++ generated languages. The warning goes away if `CYTHON_TRACE_NOGIL` is unset (even if `CYTHON_TRACE` is set).

**To Reproduce**

Use the following cython source, or clone [reproducing project](https://github.com/oleksandr-pavlyk/compiler-warning-cython-generated-source-reproducer) and execute `python setup.py build`.

```cython
# cython: language_level=3
# cython: linetrace=True

cdef class MyError(Exception):
    """
    An  exception is raised when operation submission
    or execution encounters an error.
    """

cdef void foo(int err) nogil except *:
    with gil:
        raise MyError(err)

def handler(int err):
    if (err % 2):
        with nogil:
            foo(err)
    else:
        print("All good")
```

**Expected behavior**

Generated code should compile cleanly using cython=0.29.* as it already does using Cython=3.0.0a10.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Linux
 - Python version: all
 - Cython version reproduced with versions 0.29.24-0.29.27

comment_data.body: @scoder Since this is fixed in 3.0, should this issue be closed?
It seems worth finding out what fixed this. If it was a simple and self-contained fix at the time, it might be easy to backport it.

@scoder It has taken awhile to find, but the commit 7d99b0f085bb254e9a9b4a9fe50aefe133837a81 fixed the issue. 

Not sure if this is easy to backport. A straightforward cherry-picking of this commit atop 0.29.28 runs into conflicts.
Conflicts are confined to `Cython/Compiler/Nodes.py` and were straightforward to resolve. I opened #4703 please review

Reverted for 0.29.x in https://github.com/cython/cython/commit/7fbf5eeeb19983aa65938fd262508d8758f47da8.
See #4796.
Keeping this closed since it is fixed in recent 3.0 alpha releases.

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: [BUG] Generated C/C++ source compiles with maybe-uninitialized warning with CYTHON_TRACE_NOGIL set
